text: Earl Old Person (April 13, 1929 â€“ October 13, 2021) was an American Native political leader. He was Chief of the Blackfeet tribe in Montana.William L. Bryan, Montana's Indians: yesterday and today, Farcountry Press, 1996, p.66 In 1993, Old Person delivered the first State of the Indian Nation address to the Montana Legislature. On October 13, 2021, Old Person died from cancer in Browning, Montana at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Politicians from Montana Category:Native American people Category:Cancer deaths in Montana
title: Earl Old Person
